quotes.text: Share your knowledge. It is a way to achieve immortality.

quotes.text: Do not let the behavior of others destroy your inner peace.

quotes.text: Wherever you have friends that’s your country, and wherever you receive love, that’s your home.

quotes.text: The roots of all goodness lie in the soil of appreciation for goodness.

quotes.text: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.

quotes.source: Contemporary Teachings

quotes.text: An open heart is an open mind.

quotes.source: Contemporary Teachings

quotes.text: If you can, help others; if you cannot do that, at least do not harm them.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama XIV
quotes.source: Contemporary Teachings

quotes.text: When you are discontent, you always want more, more, more. Your desire can never be satisfied. But when you practice contentment, you can say to yourself, 'Oh yes—I already have everything that I really need.'

quotes.source: Contemporary Teachings

quotes.text: The true hero is one who conquers his own anger and hatred.

quotes.text: When you plant seeds in the garden, you don’t dig them up every day to see if they have sprouted yet. You simply water them and clear away the weeds; you know that the seeds will grow in time. Similarly, just do your daily practice and cultivate a kind heart.

quotes.text: Acquire knowledge though you may die next year.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: The greatest happiness is tranquillity of mind; experience is the most beautiful ornament; the man without desires is the best companion.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: If you are intelligent, though you be weak, what can a powerful enemy do to you?
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: The king of the wild beasts, though strong, was killed by an intelligent hare.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: A scented flower, though far distant, attracts a cloud of swarming bees.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: A wise man, though possessed of immense perfections, will learn from others. By such continual practice, he will at last become omniscient.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: If a wise man behaves prudently, how can he be overcome by his enemies?
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Even a single man, by right action, can overcome a host of foes.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: A brave, wise, and fortunate man, though alone, overcomes all.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: If you are wise, you may make a slave of the great—as the garuda, though a strong and mighty bird, is made the vehicle of the god Vishnu.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: The wise, when studying, suffer pains; without exertion, it is impossible to become wise.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: He that is passionate for a small pleasure can never reach great peace.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: The ocean is never too full of water. The king's treasury is never too full of money. One is never satisfied with enjoyment. Wise men overflow with elegant sayings.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Even from children, wise men receive fine sayings.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: For the sweet scent, the navel of a musk deer must be opened.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: It is always by excellent men that good qualities are praised most.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: The scent of sandalwood is diffused by the wind into the ten corners of the world.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: If a virtuous man is chosen as Master, everyone will find contentment.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: When a ceremony is properly performed, it will be a benefit to all.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: When men are injured by a wicked ruler, then will they remember a virtuous one.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: They that suffer a malignant fever think only of cool water.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: When a wicked prince does injury, a virtuous king is ready to defend him.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: He who is occupied by an evil spirit is cheerfully assisted by a magician.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Even in decline, a virtuous man increases the beauty of his behaviour.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: A burning stick, though turned to the ground, has its flame drawn upwards.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: A virtuous prince, though far away, favourably protects his own followers.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: When the clouds in the sky gather together, the corn of the field increases.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: During life, renown is the cause of joy.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: In the world, happiness is a man's delight; without these two, a wise man can have no pleasure in wealth alone.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Excellent qualities, though not displayed, spread and become visible everywhere.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: The blossoms of the nutmeg tree, though dried, diffuse their sweet scent in all directions.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: A king is great only in his dominions, while a virtuous man is respected wherever he goes.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: A flower is beautiful for a day; a gem is everywhere esteemed.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: A hen at rest lays many eggs. A peacock, when still, has a handsome tail. A gentle horse has a swift pace. Quietness is the sign of a sage.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Though equal benefits be conferred on the excellent and the vulgar, the return is not equal.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Though there is no difference in the seed sown in different fields, yet there is immense variety in the crop.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Preserve your noble descent by your conduct—when your practice is bad, your birth is of no value.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: That sandalwood has a fine scent, but when reduced to ashes, who will buy it?
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: The great, though sometimes distressed, have no reason to be grieved.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: The moon, though eclipsed for a while, soon appears again.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: If a great man treats kindly an enemy, that very enemy comes under his sway.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: The universal monarch, since he protected all, was elevated to dignity by everyone.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: The holy man, though he be distressed, does not eat food mixed with wickedness.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: The lion, though hungry, will not eat what is unclean.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: The holy man, though it may cost him his life, will not desist from what is good.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: The color of fine gold will not change, though it be burnt and broken.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Though low-minded men may be angry with a holy man, how could that holy man become wrathful in return?
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Though the jackal may utter a nonsense language, the king of the forest mercifully protects him.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: People seek to find fault with the excellent and not with the low.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: All look with awe on costly belongings, but who would notice a fire-brand?
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Not to be cheered by praise, not to be grieved by blame. To know well one's own perfections is the characteristic sign of an excellent man.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Riches are not in vain that are gained through knowledge, strength, and skill.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: The dog and the cat, though they stand erect, are living examples of ignorance.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: It adds to the master's greatness if his disciples are well satisfied.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: As the master takes care of and kindly protects his disciples, so do the disciples manage the master's affairs.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: At the place where the great Lord Buddha is present, who would acknowledge another man?
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Though there be many bright stars in the heaven, when the sun has arisen none of them can be seen.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: A wicked man, though he obtains wealth, grows worse in his conduct.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: A stream, though turned black, endeavours to flow downwards.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Though a wicked man appears good in his conduct, it is but hypocrisy.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Though a crystal be made to have the colour of a gem, when put in water it shows its own color.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: A great man's wise arrangements are destroyed in a moment by wicked men.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: A farmer cultivates a corn-field for years and months—a hail storm suddenly destroys all effort.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: A man with bad qualities infects others.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: A crow, after eating something unclean, earnestly rubs its bill on the ground.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: If one entrusts his business to a fool, both the fool and the business will collapse.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: A true gem wants no recommendation, but a false jewel goes unwanted, though it be highly praised.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Men are often injured by men similar to themselves.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: At the rising of the sun, the stars and moon disappear.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Retain those who are helpful, though they may be enemies. Reject those who hurt you, though they may be relatives.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Buy, at whatever the price, a jewel brought from the sea. Drive out, by good medicine, the disease in your inward parts.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: When a man gains wealth within, he shows it with pride without.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: When the clouds are full of water, they move and rumble with thunder.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: It is rare to find one who is perfect, but it is rare also to find one who has no good qualities.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: A wise man will attend to one who learns more to virtue than to vice.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: It may be doubtful, at first, whether a person is an enemy or friend.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Meat, if not properly digested, becomes poison; but poison, if used rightly, may turn medicinal. So there is no need for anger, except to mortify oneself.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: With gifts, you may gather your enemies about you. When giving nothing, even your own family will leave.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: When the cow's milk become dry, the calf grows meager and wanders in sorrow.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: A master who always treats his servants kindly may easily find those who work hard.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: At lakes where many lotuses blossom, the geese gather together without being called.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: When one employs riches, when one is gentle and learned, when one protects the lower class of people—these three make others happy and are useful to oneself.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: By depending on the great, the small may rise high. See: the little plant ascending the tall tree has climbed to the top.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Though a talented man has his defect, they that delight in learning support him.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Though that atmosphere is obscured by rain, beings are made glad by it.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Rich men are numerous among the ignorant. Valiant ones abide alone with wild beasts. Elegant sayings proceed from the learned. But a Saint is rare in this world.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Every man is celebrated for the thing in which he excels—the sage as a learned person, the hero as a valiant man.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: What is respected by the great is condemned by the lowly. The precious crown of the gods is devoured by the ogre.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Knowledge existing only in books, mantras not committed to memory, and those things which a forgetful man has learned often deceive us in a time of necessity.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Offering sweet scents to dogs and pigs, a light to the blind, meat to those with indigestion, or instructions to the foolish—these actions are senseless.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: A talented man and good gold, a brave soldier and a fine horse, a skillful physician and a beautiful ornament are everywhere esteemed.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: If one is intelligent and applies himself well, what can he not accomplish? Even small bands of people, I have heard, have defeated whole armies.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Though hills and rivers, elephants and horses, sunshine and storms, and men and women are the same according to their classes, they can be distinguished by being great or lowly.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: The chief wealth consists in charity, the greatest happiness is tranquillity of mind; experience is the most beautiful ornament; the man without desires is the best companion.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: No person exists that does not sometimes desire wealth. What person is there who is always happy? Pleasure and sorrow are always changing, like summer and winter.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: If a slave behaves with great pride, if the actions of an ascetic are fruitless, if a ruler does not act according to moral law—all three have taken a misguided course.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: To act indiscreetly, to have rancor against many, to quarrel with the powerful, to be passionate for women, to cleave to what is bad—these five are the causes of quick destruction.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: When one is poor and yet desires fine garments, when one lives on charity and yet behaves haughtily, when one is ignorant of scriptures, and yet wishes to dispute—these three make one a laughing-stock among men.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Sovereigns suffer more injury from their own people than from enemies.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: By what other animals is the corpse devoured, except by worms in his own body?
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Though an enemy treats us with kindness, we should not embrace his cause.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Though a crow hurts another crow, they do not side with an owl.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: A wise man, in great or small matters, must act with due consideration.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Whether attacking a hare or an elephant, the lion has no time for indecision.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: By residing with excellent men, we may profit thereby, like birds of Sumeru who shine like gold.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: If you depend on a great but envious man, you never shall obtain renown. See how the moon declines after coming too near the sun.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Who can associate with a man who keeps no friendship?
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Though a rainbow is beautiful, only a fool would mistake it for a jewel.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: What we do not like for ourselves, we should never do for others.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: When we are injured by others, we should reflect what we think of ourselves.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: If one does to others what is agreeable to oneself, others, in the same manner, will return the kindness.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Weak-minded men think that everything they say is wrong. Those who think thus and speak little are very much suspected by others.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: He is continually happy who has the opportunity of depending on the excellent, of consulting the learned, and of conversing with the good-natured.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Speak only at the proper place and time, after having given due consideration.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: If you utter elegant sayings too often, even they lose their value.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: The defects of a learned man are seldom taken as imperfections. Those who confess such defects are often faulty men.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: If it has a wise friend for a companion, a beast can accomplish useful actions. Even if he has no wealth or servants, how much more could be done by a man?
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: We should not join with an enemy who has fought long against us, even though he wants our friendship.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: If fire meets with hot water, will it not be extinguished?
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: We may rely upon an enemy if he is good-natured, righteous, and honest. I have heard that, by resorting to a good-tempered enemy for protection, one has been defended by him to life's end.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé

quotes.text: Though you be well acquainted with the subject, do everything with due consideration.
quotes.author: Sakya Pandita
quotes.source: Sakya Lekshé
